summary: This is a compilation of news clips from March 9, 2020, covering multiple cases handled by the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The primary Epstein-related content reports that Prince Andrew declined to cooperate with the U.S. investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators, and details personnel changes at the MCC following Epstein's suicide. Other sections cover unrelated cases including a horse racing doping scandal, the trial of CIA leaker Joshua Schulte, the arrest of Lawrence Ray, and commentary on SDNY independence and Attorney General William Barr.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: British royal, friend of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Reportedly declined to cooperate with the U.S. investigation into Epstein's co-conspirators, despite a public offer to help. Has denied accusations of sexual misconduct.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Announced that Prince Andrew had 'shut the door' on cooperation. Also announced indictments in a horse racing doping case and the arrest of Lawrence Ray. Asserted the SDNY's independence from political concerns.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: The subject of a U.S. investigation into co-conspirators following his suicide in the Metropolitan Correctional Center in August 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: British socialite, longtime associate of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as a focus of the FBI probe into individuals who facilitated Epstein's alleged trafficking of underage girls.

persons.name: Jermaine Darden
persons.context: The captain in charge when Epstein died; was expected to be transferred to FCI Fort Dix as an 'emergency preparedness officer'.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: MCC officer accused of sleeping and falsifying records the night of Epstein's death; pleaded not guilty.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: MCC officer accused of sleeping and falsifying records the night of Epstein's death; pleaded not guilty.

persons.name: Montell Figgins
persons.role: Defense Attorney for Officer Michael Thomas

persons.name: Lamine N'Diaye
persons.context: Warden during Epstein's death; was moved to a desk job in Pennsylvania, with a planned transfer to Fort Dix put on hold by AG Barr.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Ordered the transfer of former warden N'Diaye to be put on hold. Subject of a CNN opinion piece criticizing his credibility and independence.

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.role: Spokesman for U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Declined to comment on options being considered regarding Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation.

persons.name: Clare Montgomery
persons.context: Reportedly represents Prince Andrew on matters related to Epstein; declined to comment.

persons.name: Jason Servis

persons.name: Danielle Sassoon

events.title: Prince Andrew Declines Cooperation
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman announces that Britain's Prince Andrew has declined to cooperate with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators, contrary to his public offer.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found hanging in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 6:30 a.m.

events.title: MCC Captain Transfer Announced
events.description: Reports indicate MCC Captain Jermaine Darden, in charge during Epstein's suicide, is expected to be transferred to FCI Fort Dix as an 'emergency preparedness officer'.

events.title: Horse Racing Doping Indictments
events.description: SDNY announces indictments against 27 individuals, including trainers Jorge Navarro and Jason Servis, in an international racehorse doping scheme.

events.title: Joshua Schulte Trial Ends in Hung Jury
events.description: Trial of former CIA programmer Joshua Schulte, accused of leaking documents to WikiLeaks, ends with a hung jury on major counts but convictions on contempt and false statements.

events.title: Arrest of Lawrence Ray
events.description: Lawrence Ray was arrested at his home in Piscataway, NJ, and charged with sex trafficking, forced labor, and extortion related to alleged exploitation of Sarah Lawrence College students.

events.title: Harvey Weinstein Injured in Jail
events.description: Harvey Weinstein fell and was injured at Rikers Island jail, complaining of dizziness and a possible concussion ahead of his sentencing.

keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman stated that Prince Andrew had 'completely shut the door' on voluntary cooperation with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators.
MCC Captain Jermaine Darden, who was in charge when Epstein died, was slated for transfer to FCI Fort Dix, following a pattern similar to the former warden.
The FBI probe into Epstein's network was focusing on Ghislaine Maxwell and others who allegedly facilitated the trafficking of underage girls.
A federal judge (Reggie Walton) issued a scathing opinion questioning Attorney General William Barr's credibility and political independence regarding the Mueller report.
The SDNY enacted coronavirus entry bans for its courthouses, prohibiting anyone who recently traveled to heavily impacted countries or had contact with the virus.
